intro: Synotis jowaiensis, commonly known as the Jowai mountain vine, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. Synotis jowaiensis is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments at high altitudes.
